headline: Italy Isn't the Problem
summary: Silvio Berlusconi isn't the problem. Italy's spending isn't the problem. It's not unions or benefits. The euro zone isn't the problem. Neither are Greece, José Manuel Barroso, Nicolas Sarkozy or Angela Merkel. The problem is the banks.

This year marks the date 11/11/11, which many bachelors and bachelorettes see as an auspicious date to end their unattached days by getting married or entering a romantic relationship.

But this year the tradition, begun hundreds of years ago to pay tribute to water itself, has taken on a profound new irony amid flooding in the country.
